main event: A civilian observed a metallic, disc-shaped object near Lachine, Michigan on September 12, 1967.
interesting points: The object resembled a thick, round metallic disc with rounded edges and runners on the bottom.
The object was first seen as a bright searchlight-like object, then appeared as a solid metallic mass.
The object hovered and moved at high speeds, making sudden stops and right-angle turns.
The object emitted a low humming sound and a bright light around the bottom.
The observer was unable to estimate the object's distance, but it appeared to be around 700-1000 feet away at closest.
